task.title: Configuring Ethernet interfaces by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure the Ethernet interfaces of the appliance by using the Network Settings page in the .

context.p: You can configure Ethernet interfaces by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure Ethernet interfaces, see .

When you edit an Ethernet interface, you can choose to test the connection. When you select this option, the Ethernet interface is temporarily configured to use the new settings. The connection test validates the Ethernet interface configuration, including the IP address and gateway. If gateway information is provided, the test attempts to ping that gateway. Therefore, you must have a cable plugged into the Ethernet port you are configuring, and that Ethernet interface must be able to reach the gateway. After the test is complete, the settings of the Ethernet interface are returned to the last saved values.

step.cmd: Go to the Network Settings page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Network Settings in the Customize appliance settings pane.
From the Appliance menu, click Network Settings.

step.cmd: To edit an Ethernet interface, select an interface from the Ethernet Interfaces pane and click the Edit icon.
